name: FNUM
purpose: This function returns the file_number for a file opened with the OPENV (Open Variable) command.

parts.description: The name of the file. This needs to be in standard alpha notation or as an A type field (e.g., ‘BKARCUST’).

return_type: I Will return the file_number if found. If it is not found, the function will return 0.
comments: This function will allow you to use the old form OPEN command and still make use of certain functions that require the file_number instead of the file name.
example:
This function can be embedded in any other function so that you don’t need to keep the file_number in another field. For example:
? flerr(fnum(‘BKARCUST’))
0
? eof(fnum(‘BKARCUST’))
.F.
